note: Defines developmental progression (PRECEDES) between InteractionType nodes. A -[:PRECEDES]-> B means A is the developmental precursor — learners typically master A before B is introduced. This encodes the interaction interface curriculum.

precedes.notes: Letter recognition precedes phoneme manipulation
Phoneme-level manipulation precedes word/sentence assembly
Binary choice precedes ternary — increasing cognitive demand
Standard 4-option format introduced from Y3-Y4
5-option with None/All adds metacognitive demand (Y5+)
Simple spoken answer precedes recorded explanation with playback
Oral recording bridges to typed single-word responses
Single word expands to short phrase (3-10 words)
Full sentence requires syntactic construction and punctuation
Extended response with claim, evidence, reasoning structure
Specialist text input for Computing (Y6+)
From placement to sequencing — adds ordinality
From linear sequence to multi-category classification
Constrained tile assembly scaffolds free text production
Binary match precedes multi-dimensional comparative analysis
Categorical sorting precedes structured comparison table
Linear number exploration precedes place value structure
Concrete manipulative understanding precedes formal written algorithm
Addition algorithm precedes subtraction with exchange
Part-whole visual model precedes area/array model
Multiplicative structure precedes formal division algorithm
Selection and identification precedes annotation and commentary
Open observation precedes guided Socratic inference chain
Single-text inference precedes comparative multi-source analysis
Labelling features on an image precedes mapping relationships between concepts
Annotating evidence in text precedes building a relationship map
